---
title: "Data Sources"
---

## Overview

OmicIDX aggregates metadata from multiple public genomics databases. All data is extracted, cleaned, and standardized into a unified data warehouse.

## Source Databases

### NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA)

- **URL**: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra
- **Update Frequency**: Daily
- **Data Types**: Studies, Experiments, Runs, Samples
- **Access**: Public API and FTP

### NCBI Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO)

- **URL**: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo
- **Update Frequency**: Daily
- **Data Types**: Series, Samples, Platforms
- **Access**: Public API and FTP

### NCBI BioSample

- **URL**: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample
- **Update Frequency**: Daily
- **Data Types**: Sample metadata
- **Access**: Public API

### NCBI BioProject

- **URL**: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject
- **Update Frequency**: Daily
- **Data Types**: Project metadata
- **Access**: Public API

### EBI BioSample

- **URL**: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/biosamples
- **Update Frequency**: Daily
- **Data Types**: Sample metadata
- **Access**: Public REST API

## Data Processing

1. **Extraction**: Data is extracted from source databases via APIs/FTP
2. **Transformation**: Data is cleaned and standardized using SQLMesh
3. **Storage**: Data is stored as parquet files in a frozen data lake
4. **Deployment**: Data is deployed to Cloudflare R2 (or S3-compatible storage)

## Update Frequency

All datasets are updated **daily** from their source databases. The data warehouse reflects the state of source databases as of the last update.

## Data Provenance

Each dataset maintains links to source accessions and includes metadata about:
- Source database
- Extraction date
- Update frequency
- Data version
